message.content:
To find the systematic allocation of the depreciable amount of an asset over its useful life from the provided cash flow statement, we specifically look for the line item related to depreciation.

1. We go through the cash flow information item by item.
2. We find the line labeled "Depreciation," which represents the systematic allocation of an asset's depreciable amount.

In the provided problem:

| Account | Amount | Date |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Cash Flow From Operating Activities |  | 2024-01-29 |
| Net Profit  | -1175062.19 | 2024-01-29 |
| Depreciation  | 45765.70 | 2024-01-29 |
| (Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable  | -3558301.64 | 2024-01-29 |
| (Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable  | -1731.44 | 2024-01-29 |
| (Increase) Decrease in Inventory  | -3760000.00 | 2024-01-29 |
| Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable  | 2700000.00 | 2024-01-29 |
| Increase (Decrease) in Tax Payable  | 354996.05 | 2024-01-29 |
| Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities  | -5394333.52 | 2024-01-29 |
| Cash Flow from Investing Activities |  | 2024-01-29 |
| Purchase of Fixed Assets  | 2265288.42 | 2024-01-29 |
| Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities  | -2265288.42 | 2024-01-29 |
| Cash and Cash Equivalents |  | 2024-01-29 |
| Beginning Balance  | 8000000.00 | 2024-01-29 |
| Ending Balance  | 340378.06 | 2024-01-29 |
| Net Increase  | -7659621.94 | 2024-01-29 |

3. The value associated with "Depreciation" is **45765.70**.
4. This value represents the depreciation expense which is part of the cash flow from operating activities.

Thus, the final output in the required JSON format is:

```json
{"solution": {'value': '45765.70'} }
```
